original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at 308.50/310 to the US dollar, bond yields steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka bonds opened steady on Wednesday, dealers said while the spot was trading at 308.50/310 rupees to the US dollar.
The market was dull ahead of the five day banking holidays, dealers said.
Sri Lanka’s banks and financial markets will be closed on Friday June 30 with Thursday (Hajj) and Monday (Poya Day) also statutory holidays.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 24.00/25.00 percent, steady from 24.00/75 percent on Tuesday. (Colombo/ June 28/2023)
